title: GuardAction
description: Defines the response executed by a NavigationGuard when its condition evaluates to false (access denied). Specifies whether to redirect the user, block navigation in place, notify with a message, or prompt for confirmation — along with the target destination and whether to preserve the attempted route for post-authentication redirect.

action.description: The action taken when the guard denies access to the target route.

target.description: Destination for redirect or replace actions — a Route ID (e.g., 'login') or an absolute URL. Ignored for block and notify actions.

message.description: User-facing message shown when action is 'notify' or 'prompt', explaining why access was denied.

preserveRoute.description: When true, the originally attempted route is stored (e.g., in session state) so the user can be redirected back to it after successfully authenticating.
